column2: The Islamic Brotherhood
The Sunnis secretly follow the teachings of the Quran, believed to have been verbally recited to Muhammed by God. They will proclaim that Muhammed is chosen by God, as prophet and the first Imam.
The Salafi Preachers

The followers of the teachings of pre-event theologian Abd al-Wahhab are an organization that promises to expand the teachings of the Salafi/Wahhabi school of Islam to the world, proving it to be the correct way of practice.
The Atlas Loyals
The Malakite faith believes that only those of house Alouite can claim the Caliphate over all of Islam. Its most loyal followers promise to preach their faith to the corners of the world.
The Secret Tariqa
Amongst the schools of Sufism, the Secret Tariqa is devoted to preach the teachings of Sufism mysticism to all other religions followers, ensuring that the faith of Islam shall be triumphant.
The Ibadi Faithful

The Ibadi faith is said to predate both the Sunni and Shia schools of Islam. There are several doctrinal differences between these later branches and the orthodox Ibadi. For examples, the Ibadi do not believe there has to be one leader for all of the Muslim communities. However, their fervent faith in Allah is the same.
The Party of Ali

The Shiites secretly follow the teachings of the Quran, believed to have been verbally recited to Muhammed by God. They will proclaim that Muhammed is chosen by God, as prophet and the first Imam. They spread their belief that God, through Muhammed, chose Ali as his successor, and thus the first caliph of the state of Islam. They will stand by what they believe to be the true word of god.
The Wise Ones

The Druze follow the teachings of the Epistles of Wisdom, which includes the Old Testament, the Qur'an and the philosophical works by Plato. The faithful believe that God is the whole of existence, unlimited and omnipresent. To unite with the Cosmic Mind and reach ultimate happiness, a Druze must live through many successive reincarnations.
The Baptised

The The Mandeans are a rather secretive faith, which makes secret practice of the religion not as hard. Nevertheless, the followers of John the Baptist will withstand all kinds of oppression and emerge as an important faith.
The Hands of the Cause

The Hands of the Cause were refounded after the Event to spread the teachings of their great founder. This secretive society focuses on the spread of the faith by conversion of people from different faiths throughout the world.
The Silent Council

The Ahmadiyya faith has been for centuries in a difficult position, reduced apparently to only India. The more zealous followers have founded therefore the Silent Council, a secret society dedicated to spread their teachings to all.
The Students of Hammurabi

The Students are the society dedicated to pass down the wisdom of Mesopotamianism to all non-believers and convert them to the rightful faith. As Hammurabi brought the law of Allah to Mesopotamia, so will the Students of this great king pass it to all others.
The Followers of the Crossed Moons
The faith of the Empire of Nigeria is often seen as less missionary focused then others. However, the Followers are different, spreading the beliefs of Chrislam to faraway lands.
The Visionaries

The most zealous followers of Is'mail the Visionary believe the faith has to be spread to ensure unity in the divided faiths. Taking the name of Visionaries to emulate the last ruler of the Sahara, they travel far and wide to make anyone aware of the truth of Muwahidunna.
The Pure Brotherhood

From the very earliest days, the Ismaili faithful have been persecuted by those who did not understand. In those ancient days, the followers of God turned to secrecy to hide themselves from the eyes of the unbelievers. They will persevere again, until the whole world knows the glory of God.
União do Cristo Redentor

Split from the Roman Catholic Church, the Igreja Apostolica has found itself as the most prominent faith in the lands of Brazil, and now seek to expand outwards, forming organizations such as the Union of Christ the Redeemer.
The Signs on the Way

As followers of the Way of Steel, the Ironists believe their objective to spread the faith both by conquest and by kindness. The Signs, taking the name of the objects that once guided the metal chariots of the Pre-Event world, plan to preach to all the greatness of Steel.
The Imperial Duma

The ancient Imperial Duma was an organ meant to help the Tsar in his great duties. However, it was destroyed and fell, disappearing from the annals of history. Reborn after the Event, the Imperial Duma is now an order dedicated once more at spreading the glory of the Holy Tsars.
The Empress' Court

The faith in the Great Tsarina Catherine is a minority compared to the faith of Zarism. Yet, the faithful in those lands survive underground, following the great teachings of the Tsarina and proselytizing to all the others.
The Great Ambassadors

The faith in Tsar Peter the Great is a minority compared to the faith of Zarism, who places him as only one of the greatest instead of the sole one. The faithful survive in those lands, following the great teachings of the Tsar and proselytizing to all the others.
People's Commissariat for External Affairs

Persecuted by both Zarists and other faiths, Stalinism still stands proudly against all enemies. However, some of it's followers believe it is better to ensure the expansion of Stalinism through hidden means, converting all followers. It is the People's Commissariat that ensures such expansion.
The Grand International

The Trotskyite faith believes in perpetual war against all non believers until they either convert or fall. For this, the Grand International ensures the Trotskyite faith to expand underground, ensuring it's survival even as it's enemies plot to destroy it.
The Unaligned

Titoists are a fringe movement among the Stalinists. Believers in the greatness of Lord Tito, they claim Stalin to be only a false idol. The Unaligned swear to spread this faith until it becomes the dominant one in the world, for the glory of the godly ruler of ancient Yugoslavia.
The Enlightened

The followers of Madame Guillotine are many in the academies and circles of knowledge of the known world. With the Revolution imminent, it is only natural that The Enlightened are more active than ever.
The Keepers of Faith

Split from the Liturgicals after the Event, the Vagarna faithful follow the "true" spirit of Protestantism, Folkish faith and personal connection to God through an almost total decentralization of spiritual authority.
Coven of the Serpent

Named after the form Satanael took to disguise himself, the Einblickers seek to undermine and ultimately destroy the Papacy in Rome, viewing it as a servant of Yaldabaoth, the false evil God. They were originally a faction within the Vagarna that split off relatively recently and embraced Gnostic beliefs, making themselves infidels in the eyes of the Liturgicals and the Vagarna alike.
The Hidden Riders
As the Wrath of the Khan fights openly to ensure the growth of the Khan's glory, it is the Hidden Riders that secretly travel from land to land to convince more people of the glory of the Great Khan.
The Eternal Kindlers

The Eternal Flame of the revolution started by the Chairman still burns in the east. However, to spread it needs more people to feel it's power. The Eternal Kindlers believe this to be their objective, to spread the flame by igniting the spirits of the non believers.
The Hidden Synagogue

Followers of the United Synagogue are usually tolerated in and around Britain, but they tend to be looked down upon in other lands. Nevertheless, the United Synagogue faithful stay resolute and practice their faith in secret.
The Secret Kehilla

Supporters of the Federation of Synagogues are all too used to being the downtrodden party, even before the event. That's why they also know how to practice their faith in secret when the need arises.
The True Buddhists
The followers of Bhimrao Ambedkar follow a different doctrine to that of most other Buddhists and are seen as rather wayward by Hindus, and thus often resort to practicing their faith in secret.
Ali's Chosen
The Alawites are no strangers to persecution, but have thus grown resilient, Ali's Chosen now resort to continue practicing their faith in secret.
The Eightfold Path

Those who secretly follow the teachings of Buddha focus on asceticism and distancing themselves of worldly possessions as much as they can without notice. A belief in rebirth into the wheel of life and death makes them distance themselves of all cravings, which bring only pain. There are those who would rather plant a good karmic seed through rebirth than renounce these teachings, as an open profession of faith is not always needed to grow closer to Nirvana.
The Keepers of the Vajra

The Keepers are traveling monks of the Vajrayana faith. Originally travelers from village to village in the plains of Mongolia, they have since expended, walking the ancient paths left by the men before the Event to bring the teachings of Vajrayana into the world.
The Travelers

The Travelers are a secret society focused on bringing the teachings of Thammayuttika to the soon to be colonized lands. Those warrior monks from far off Siam are strong enough to defend themselves from the many hostile threat they face, and their knowledge is such that many of the western people they have met have adered secretly to their faith, spreading it further.
The Masters of the Three Tantra

The Gelugpa followers are the majority in Tibet, following the great Dalai Lama. His most devout followers have founded the Masters to teach those beyond the mountains the way of Gelug. Often traveling alone, with nothing but the essential, those people hide the intention of proselytizing behind many excuses, for many rulers do not appreciate to see the power of the Dalai Lama grow in their land.
The Red Masters

While the Gelugpa faith under the Dalai Lama is the more widespread faith in Tibet, the followers of the Red Hat Schools are not far behind. Following the Penchen Lama, many of them choose to travel to enlighten the followers of both Gelugpa and foreign faith, in hopes to end the schism that has brought division on Tibet, and to expand their influence beyond.
The Homeseekers

The Homeseekers are traveling monks of the Budaism faith. They proclaim that they are acting like Buda, the founder of the religion. They search for the best places to preach and gain followers to the faith.
The Anticipators

The Anticipators are traveling monks of the Leninist faith. They proclaim that they are laying the groundwork for the Leninov to arrive. They search for the best places to preach and gain followers to the faith.
The Ascetic Ones
The Ascetic Ones are Oscvicenist monks who spread the faith in private circles. They seek to teach their enlightened ways to all those who are willing to listen.
Council of the Evangelical Brotherhood

Drawing from an Old Order of Confessors and Monks during the Reign of Stalin, members of this Brotherhood work tirelessly to keep their traditions and faith alive under even the most oppressive of rulers and paranoid of tyrants.
Guru Followers
The Guru Followers are a secret order that follows the Sikh faith. Members of the Guru Followers can attempt to convert others to the rightful faith, and spread the words of the Guru to all
The Guides of Bhagavanism

The Guides of Bhagavanism are a secret order dedicated to the expansion of the teaching of Bhagavan, not by the sword but through conversion. The Neo-Vedantic and other Indians of different faiths are their primary target, but some even venture beyond the borders of Bharat.
The Veda Readers

The Readers travel through Indian teaching of peace and contemplation, reading the sacred Vedas to any willing to listen. Their troubled journey can be difficult and dangerous, but those man refuse to let their teachings go unlistened.
The Harmless

Nothing has changed for the Jain follower after the Event: to conquer our inner passions is to become Jina. The Jains take five vows of self-discipline and asceticism in their search of spiritual development. Ahmisa: to love and cause no harm to other living beings. Satya: to always speak the truth. Asteya: to never take that which is not willingly offered. Brahmacharya: to adopt chastity or celibacy. Aparigraha: the renunciation of worldly possessions. To be Jain is to never break such vows, even when doing so is in itself a secret that tries Satya to its very limits.
The Ne'emanim

Outside of the borders of Israel, the Ne'emanim still believe in the glory of the great kingdom of God. The Most Loyal keep in touch with each other and are even welcoming to other people that attempt to follow the teachings of God.
The Chachamim

While still believing in Orthodox Judaism, the Chachamim support the belief that the King of Israel is not the Messiah promised by God, they believe that the Messianic age has arrived and actively search for the true Messiah of the Jewish people.
League of Jewish Faithful

While at first considered part of the same community as Old World Judaism, American Judaism has long split from their Old World brethren due to lack of communication and has evolved very differently over the centuries, mostly rejecting the claim that the Messianic age has arrived, they believe that individual faithful must do their part to make the world ready for the arrival of the Messiah.
The Hidden Hasidim

Originating from the Old World, the Hasidic movement has found its home in America and nowadays, holds most of its influence there. As a spiritual revival movement within Judaism, Hasidics are noted for their traditionalism and seclusion, resulting in them being isolated from the rest of America, this self reliance has turned out to be helpful in the long run, as they are easily able to regroup in case disaster strikes.
The Community of Israel

A sect of Judaism which developed their own traditions and doctrines, the Haymanot have been viewed as infidels and or heretics by Muslims, Christians and even other Jews. Due to that, they're naturally resilient to religious oppression and hold strong to their own teachings.
Hidden Nestlings

The people of the Thunderbird, the guardian of seasons, the keeper of eternal balance. Have long been considered heathens by Christians and the like, but their hardy nature keeps them steadfast in their belief, and sometimes form hidden "Nests", whose members are called "Nestlings", hidden communities of Four Guardians faithful to keep their faith strong.
Hidden Nestlings

The people of the Thunderbird, the guardian of seasons, the keeper of eternal balance. Have long been considered heathens by Christians and the like, but their hardy nature keeps them steadfast in their belief, and sometimes form hidden "Nests", whose members are called "Nestlings", hidden communities of Four Guardians faithful to keep their faith strong.
The Star Witnesses

As the Zvezdniki faith is considered pagan and fringe by Christian churches, Zvezdiniki followers looked on favourably by neighbouring religions. That said, the followers of the stars are hardy people, and are more than able to keep their faith in secret under any kind of persecution. One day, their day will come and the stars, sun and moon will triumph.

That said, the followers of the stars are hardy people, and are more than able to keep their faith in secret under any kind of persecution. The Freemasons

The true sons of liberty, the free thinking people of America, following the doctrines and philosophies of the founding fathers who built a true bastion of liberty. They have resolved to uphold their values of freedom and liberty even in face of oppression.
The Children of Dievas

The Romuva faith was defeated centuries ago, or so the story goes. In reality, Romuva survives again, in small villages and behind closed doors. Ready to once again see the faith resurface in triumph and cast down the hated Christians that dared to insult the glory of Perkunas and the Dievas. Of this, the Children will make sure.

Ready to once again see the faith resurface in triumph and cast down the hated Christians that dared to insult the glory of Perkunas and the Dievas. Of this, the Children will make sure.
The Hidden Circle

The followers of the Druidic faith have long known persecution, especially from Christian hands. As always, they persevere, even if they must use deception. Though they utter empty prayers to foreign gods, they secretly meet in private chambers and secluded groves to offer devotion and sacrifice to Danu, the Mother and source of life. They keep their faith knowing that some day mighty Taranis the Thunderer will strike down those who have persecuted the faithful.

The Court of Miracles

The Court of Miracles is a secret society dedicated to the growth of the Novelist faith. Hiding from those that wish to capture the Novelists and chain them, first of all the evil deity Javert the Persecutor, the Novelist meet in secret in The Court of Miracles and invite only those they trust to join them.

Hiding from those that wish to capture the Novelists and chain them, first of all the evil deity Javert the Persecutor, the Novelist meet in secret in The Court of Miracles and invite only those they trust to join them.
The Winter Shadows
The Winter Shadows believe in the spread of Folklorism through secrecy. They will close on their target and slowly convince him to join the faith, ensuring the expansion of Folklorism.

The Singers of Vainamoinen

Even under the rule of another religion, the Suomenusko faith lives strong in some people. Communing with nature, they find their gods in the quiet places of the world. Among the trees, the brooks and the light of the moon, where they worship their divine kings in secret. But silence does not last forever, and it will soon be shattered by the song of Vainamoinen and the Kantele, his sweet and powerful music striking the faithless to their very heart.

Among the trees, the brooks and the light of the moon, where they worship their divine kings in secret. But silence does not last forever, and it will soon be shattered by the song of Vainamoinen and the Kantele, his sweet and powerful music striking the faithless to their very heart.
The Whispers of Alexander

Alexander Anaxorgos conquered the Olympus with the sword, and it is the duty of the Hellenic faithful that they do the same. However, some believe that it is wise to prepare the terrain for this conquest, by ensuring many of the supposed enemies already trust the faith. Those that follow this idea founded the Whispers, a group dedicated to expand the faith in secret.

However, some believe that it is wise to prepare the terrain for this conquest, by ensuring many of the supposed enemies already trust the faith. Those that follow this idea founded the Whispers, a group dedicated to expand the faith in secret.
The Punishers of Corruption

To ensure the success of Shiva's teachings, the Corruption Punishers believe they must convert as many as they can in the war against the powers of the corrupt. They seek to bring an end to all corruption in across the world, and this is the mission of this society.
The Punishers of Corruption

To ensure the success of Shiva's teachings, the Corruption Punishers believe they must convert as many as they can in the war against the powers of the corrupt. They seek to bring an end to all corruption in across the world, and this is the mission of this society.
The Trinitarians of the Sea

Following a syncretic mix of Inuit and Christian beliefs, the Tatik faithful believe in the trinity of Arakuagsak, Sassuma Arnaa and Nerrivik as the three rulers of the sea. Due to their polytheistic beliefs, they are shunned as heathens by Christians, but they hold strong to the faith of their ancestors.

Due to their polytheistic beliefs, they are shunned as heathens by Christians, but they hold strong to the faith of their ancestors.
Saint Cyril's Chosen

As the true followers of Saint Cyril and Miaphysite thought, the devotees of the Armenian Apostolic Church have long been persecuted by the Chalcedonians of the west and thus have been forced underground. Nontheless, keeping true to their faith has allowed them to persevere.
The Albatross' Followers

To guide the ships through the dangers of the sea, to avoid the ship of Nightmare Life in Death, to dodge the ambushes of the Ghost Fleet and the Flying Dutchman, a seaman needs a guide. And as thought to them by the Mariner, the Albatross' Followers intend to be that guide.
Wanderers of the Eastern Seas

The followers of the various sea gods are in the middle of a terrible storm, and are now but wanderers in the eastern seas. Those wanderers long for the day when they will hit shore and the storms pass.
The Flame Keepers

Believing themselves to be the protectors of understanding and knowledge in a world under the spell of Ahriman's ignorance, Zoroastrians organizing in secret spread the truth and light of Ahura Mazda's wisdom. Charged by their prophet with protecting the water, earth, fire and air, they enlighten others about the struggle between destructive chaos and the good of creation. Even when forced into secrecy there is yet hope, for Zoroaster told of the inevitability of Ahura Mazda's victory.
The Adherents of Time.
As followers of Zorvan, god of time, they see it as their duty to return the world to its natural state, under his aegis even if it must be done through secret.
Archangel Raphael's Faithful

Before the Event, the Archangel Raphael sent a vision to a great Saint of the Sevillian faith, showing him that the Church of Rome is sinful and corrupt and that Seville is the new bastion of Catholicism. In secret, Archangel Raphael's Faithful practice their religion and seek to convert fellow Christians to be followers of the True Papacy
The Legatino Councilmen

After a wayward group of Sevillian adventurers found the true Papacy in Mexico, they believe that both the Papacy of Rome and the Papacy of Seville are heretical and should submit to the Papacy of Mexico. This belief has relegated them to the fringes of Catholicism but they hold fast until all true Catholics realize their righteousness.
The Cadaver Society

Cadaverists are a small heretic sect that believe that one of the last Antedeluvian Popes is not in fact dead, but can still miraculously speak to members of the higher Cadaverist clergy. The Cadaver Society seeks to communicate with the immortal spirit of the Pope
The Whistful ones

Sehnsuchtism grew out of the Lutheran Church in western germany in days long lost to time. While they still retain many Lutheran doctrines, they believe the ultimate authority of the Kanzler over the Archdiocese of Lund. This belief had them branded as heretics by the Liturgical Lutherans, but the Sehnuchtists hold strong to their faith of a formation of a united rightuous Germany under the Kanzler.
Society of Luther

Lutherans are all too familiar with being oppressed by the Pope and his allies, forming secret organizations to maintain their faith in face of that. The Society of Luther is committed to the formalized doctrines of Lutheranism, as dictated by the Archdiocese of Lund.
Protestant Union

Protestants across America mostly fall under the Mainline union of Protestant churches, following a myriad of differing doctrines. Protestants have found themselves oppressed in the old world, and have resolved to keep their faith strong.
American Catholic Community

Catholics across the United States have found themselves disorganized and leaderless after the event, due to lack of communication with the Papacy. Since then, the federal government has propped up the Latin Patriarchate of Washington as the spiritual leader of Catholics in America. They hold strong to their faith, no matter where they go, even across the sea.
Baptist World Alliance

Born in antiquity, Baptism is a strain of Protestantism that is highly charismatic and vigorous. It believes in believer's baptism, meaning that only adult believers should be baptised, and that by full bodily immersion in water. They reject most of the Catholic sacraments and follow a Congregational model of Church governance.
Three-Self Patriotic Movement

In the time since the event chinese protestantism has been relatively isolated from the rest of the Christian world and while yes remaining a undoubtably christian faith has adopted some ideas from older Chinese philosophies and adapted them to suit a Christian faith. For example, these Christians pray to their pious ancestors for guidance in a similar way as the Catholics of the west and believe that their God maintains a Celestial Order to the world.
Zealots of Piety

Originating from a pre-Event split within the Russian Orthodox Church, the reasons for the Old Believers' existence is lost in the mists of time. They maintain that the Russian Church, under the influence of the demon Nikon, tried to pervert and destroy Christ's Church, creating the Zarist faith. However, their ancestors escaped into the wild, where they hid until eventually the wrath of God destroyed the apostate Russia, no longer deserving the title of 'Holy'.
World Reformed Fellowship

Born before the Event on the mountains of Switzerland, some say from a great sage born in the depth of the Alps, the Calvinist faith has greatly grown after the Event. Under rulers chosen by heaven itself (for no ruler that is not chosen could ever be King of the Calvinists for long) the Calvinist faith is prepared to fight to expand the true Christian way
Neo-Huguenot Faithful
Reborn post event the Neo-Huguenots will not see their faith fall to persecution as the ancient Huguenots once did.
Society of Saint Tito

The youngest of all Christian churches, the Yugoslavist faith was born when the Car of Yugoslavia, hard pressed in keeping his diverse Empire united, made a desperate attempt, calling a great Council of all holy men in his lands, fusing all faiths in his domains in a single religion and forcing them all to accept it or lose their heads.
Christians of the East

The Levant has long been home to several Christian denominations,such as the Assyrian Church, Chaldean Catholics, and Oriental Orthodox. These churches had few or no theological differences, and were mostly distinguished by which Rite they used to celebrate the Liturgy. However, after the Event, these differences no longer seemed as significant as the need for cohesion and survival in the face of societal collapse, and so the Syriac Orthodox and Chaldean Catholic Churches joined together. This 'new' old Church is led by the Patriarch of Antioch and All the East
Syrian Christians of India

First spread to India by Saint Thomas the Apostle over 25 centuries ago, the Nasranis have always been a minority in India. With the chaos of the Event cutting India off from most outside communication,the various Nasrani Churches (both those in communion with the Pope and those in communion with the Eastern Church) united together for the sake of convenience. The example of several holy men has caused the Nasranis to grow in popularity over the last few decades, to the point where they are a majority in a few parts of India,though they are still a minority overall
The Coptic Faithful

The Coptic faith is an ancient Christian church, dating back to millennia before the Event according to its practicioners. After the Event, it's still practiced in parts of Africa. While weak, the faith has proved resilient over the centuries, and might still survive beyond the 26th century
The Poor

The followers of Matta El Meskeen, whose teachings were often rejected by the Coptic leadership, are no strangers to being forced to go underground and practice their teachings in secret. That's why after the chaos of the Event, many of them came together and became 'The Poor', named in reverence of Father Matta.
Society of the Sacred Mission

Native to antediluvian England, the Anglican Church has long since been practically extinct in its homeland. It regards itself as a 'via media' or middle way between Protestantism and Catholicism. Its religious head is the king of England. Though barely extant in the British Isles it is not impossible for it to return to its former glory.
Episcopal Community

Native to antediluvian England, the Episcopal Church has long since been practically extinct in its homeland. It regards itself as a 'via media' or middle way between Protestantism and Catholicism. Though no longer extant in the British Isles, it survived in Canada and parts of Africa, with local bishops presiding over congregations and powerful local rulers being proclaimed King of England for patronising the Church.
The True Catholics

The Sedevacantists of America reject the authority of the Latin Patriarch of Washington as the spiritual leader of American Catholicism and seek to find the true Papacy in the Old World. Rejected by the American government, they are now scattered but still hold strong in their quest to find the true Pope in Rome.
The Evangelical Alliance

Though having roots in the Old World, the Evangelical faith is now mostly an American faith. Derived from antediluvian Protestantism, it believes in the doctrine of salvation by grace alone and focuses on the centrality of the conversion experience to Christian life (traditionally known as 'being born again'). In its long isolation in America due to persecution by the American government, they have become more decentralized and more self-dependent.
The Sword-Minded

Though they claim to be Christians, the Batenburgers possess beliefs that mark them as being well outside the traditional Christian mainstream, believing in their unrestricted right to not only take violent vengeance upon unbelievers, but also to plunder and pillage them by force. Their highly combative nature makes them adept at war, but earns them the ire of their neighbours.
The Society of Jesus

Ever since the Event, Christians have marked themselves by their refusal to abandon their faith in the face of persecution. So it is that a rich tradition of martyrs and underground parishes can give hope to groups of believers in even the darkest of times, no matter what they are outwardly forced to profess. To each other they can profess their true faith in God, and their God is love.
The Old Christians

Seeing themselves as walking in the footsteps of the Apostles who first built the Church in the name of Christ, there are Christians who will not give up their faith, even when circumstance has forced them to renounce their words. They continue the good work, building their faith and their church, knowing in their hearts that they are doing God's will.
Ave Constantine

Following the Marblist faith and considered heretics by the Ecumenical Patriarchs. The Marblists believe in the return of Emperor Constantine to lead the true Christian faithful to greatness in a new Empire.
The Fraticelli Faithful

Ever since its humble roots, Christians have marked themselves by their refusal to abandon their faith in the face of persecution. So it is that a rich tradition of martyrs and underground parishes can give hope to groups of believers in even the darkest of times, no matter what they are outwardly forced to profess. To each other they can profess their true faith in God, and their God is love.
The Hus' Believers

Those that follow the faith founded by the legendary Jan Hus before the Event are rare apparently. However, that is because it is here they meet, organizing underground groups that one day will bring the Hussite faith to light in triumph.
Peers of Mirrazum

Considering themselves the most "matured" among humanity, the Peers of Mirrazum seek to spread the faith of Mirrazumdrost, hoping to help humanity mature collectively to reach the mental and collective advancement of the pre-Event era.
Peers of Mirrazum

Considering themselves the most "matured" among humanity, the Peers of Mirrazum seek to spread the faith of Mirrazumdrost, hoping to help humanity mature collectively to reach the mental and collective advancement of the pre-Event era.
Her Majesty's Most Faithful

Followers of the Queen and Thelemic thought, Thelema faithful have long been considered as hedonists and degenerates by the Christian churches, but their loyalty to her majesty the Queen is stronger than any condemnation they may face, and work tirelessly to keep their ways alive.
The Free-Willed

Followers of the old Thelemic ways, before the institution of the Council of Wisdom and the High Sorcerer, they are viewed as traitors by the mainstream Thelemics but their faith in the true will of the Queen will prevail.
People of Avalon

Followers the Summer Queen sect of Thelema, they believe in the Queen as the ruler of Summer while her consort the Knight as the King of Winter. They believe that they are blessed by the King of Winter who will guard them from harm with his sword Excalibur.
The Ultraunionists

Followers of the Thelemic Lodge of the Orange King, they follow the consort of the Queen, Hadit. They also pledge absolute loyalty to the Queen and Britannia with unmatched zeal. Naturally, they seek to spread the glory of the Queen wherever they go.
The Hidden Ahle Quran

While the Ahle Quran society has dedicated itself to spreading the true message of Islam through the Koran only. In the aftermath of the event, persecutions against Qurani teachers only continued, so the remaining Qurani scholars came together to reform the society once more, but also established a "hidden" wing of the new organization, which preaches Qurani teachings in secret. Followers of the Syafi'i school are usually majority in Malay sultanates, but they tend to be looked down upon in other lands. Nevertheless, the Syafi'i faithful stay resolute and practice their faith in secret.

Bumiputera, directly translated as Son of the Land, is a term ascribed to Malay inhibatants of Malaya peninsula and Borneo isle. Most of whom followed Pusaka school of Sunnism. The term have been aptly adopted for this society, which assist secret adherents in both concealing and spreading their faith, in hope that the school shall rise once more.

To many Gidoggyo faithful, the Blessed Virgin Mary is seen as the patron saint of their homeland, as stories tell of her liberating the people of Korea from the yoke of Japanese overlordship in the days before the Event. Today, many devout followers of the Way of Christ who are forced underground for one reason or another look up to the Blessed Virgin for guidance.

Back in the long forgotten days of the Edo jidai, Christianity was banned by the Tokugawa Shogunate, forcing many of its practitioners underground, they were known as the "Kakure Kirishitan" or "Hidden Christians", while the ban was eventually lifted centuries later, circumstances have again forced devout Kirishitan followers underground, reforming the old Kakure Kirishitan movement.

The beliefs of the Isukirians are seen as heretical by even their Christian brethren in Japan, and thus it is not uncommon for them to forced underground in order to continue their practices, nevertheless, the Isukirians know that much like how Jesus lived to be 103, true followers of the faith will also have long and happy lives.
The Society of Jesus in the Orient

Aglipayans have, since their formation, been in opposition to the dogma and influence of the far away Catholic Church, preferring that an independent church be established in the Philippines instead, while they achieved prominence in days long forgotten, the aftermath of the Event and the rising power of the Archbishop of Manila has weakened the power of the Aglipayans who again find themselves forced underground. Nevertheless, Aglipayan faithful carry on and hold on to their independence.

The herbalistic and syncretic beliefs of the El Shaddai are widely seen as heretical by the Patriarchate of Manila, forcing many of its followers into hiding, but that did nothing to deter the spread of the faith, as many followers of the El Shaddai way continue practicing it in secret.

The followers of the Eastern Lightning movement have long opposed the Great Red Dragon that oppressed China for centuries, and thus formed many secret societies to combat its influence and spread their own teachings. Many who find themselves opposed to the doctrine of the Ruby Chairman are welcomed into those many secret societies to carry on the struggle to establish the Kingdom of God.

Utter loyalty and devotion to the Kim family does not stop at the borders of Korea, it is to be spread to and enlighten the masses around the world as well, as the Supreme Leader's Chosen seek to accomplish.

It is true that the Hongxiejiao believe that every method is allowed to increase the power of the Ruby Chairman, including the formation of hidden secret societies to help spread the influence of the Hongxiejiao faith, and to combat the passive Liehuo who don't have what it takes to fight the traitors and infidels.

Since his exile to the island of Taiwan by the Ruby Chairman, the Sapphire Didact has worked tirelessly to rebuild his power and influence to be able to return to China and restore harmony to the universe. Shintoism itself is home to diverse sets of beliefs, and the Western Shinto faith is one of those beliefs. The Western Shintoist hope for a sacred, unified and peaceful Japan never died, even when faced with opposition, they continue spreading the word in secret.

While rarely facing discrimination in their homeland of Japan, the Amida Shinto faithful have found themselves forced underground, where they continue their syncretism of Buddhism and Shintoism in secret.

The Northern Shinto are seen as somewhat wayward by their southern neighbours, as their veneration of native Ainu deities is not seen anywhere else in Japan, as such, many have tried oppressing the beliefs of the Northern Shinto to little success, and while they find themselves in hiding, the Northern Shinto intend to continue their practices in secret.
Followers of the Ultimate Ancestors

The followers of the native religion of the Ryukyu islands are no strangers to oppressions, and again find themselves oppressed and forced into hiding. The Shinko followers still intend to persevere and continue their beliefs in secret.
Followers of the Spirits

Followers of the shamanistic beliefs native to Korea have begun a resurgence since the Event, but still face oppression by their neighbors, especially the followers of Christ. The followers of the Spirits are still undeterred and are determined to continue their ways in secret.
Devotees of Txiv Yawg

The Kev Dab Qhuas followers of Txiv Yawg and other deities have found their homeland ruled by tyrants such as the Red and Yellow Emperors, until Txiv Yawg liberated them and freed their homeland, earning the peoples eternal devotion. column4: Anhänger der Bön-Religion beten viele Götter und Geister an. Sie streben Vollkommenheit durch die Befolgung des Dzogchen an, einem der neun Fahrzeuge (oder Wege) des Bön-Glaubens. column6: Los seguidores de la religión bön adoran muchos dioses y espíritus. Sus adeptos buscan la Gran perfección mediante el dzogchen, uno de los Nueve vehículos (o caminos) de la fe bön. En secreto, los fieles del bön siguen sacrificando animales hechos de harina de cebada para apaciguar a los grandes poderes.

column2: The Khurmazta believe that there are two original principles of the universe - the good Light and the evil Darkness. By a cosmic accident, the two has been mixed, and everything is tainted but God. Mankind's purpose is to spread the wisdom of their benevolent God and releasing their own inner Light through good conduct and kind actions.
column3: Les mazdakites croient qu'il y a deux principes à l'origine de l'univers - la bonne Lumière et les Ténèbres maléfiques. Par un accident cosmique, les deux ont été mélangés, et tout est entaché sauf Dieu. Le but de l'humanité est de répandre la sagesse de leur Dieu bienveillant et de libérer leur propre Lumière intérieure par les bonnes actions.
column4: Die Manichäisten glauben, dass es zwei ursprüngliche Grundprinzipien des Universums gibt: das gute Licht und die böse Finsternis. Durch einen kosmischen Unfall wurden diese beiden Prinzipien vermischt und ist alles außer Gott befleckt. Der Zweck der Menschheit besteht darin, die Weisheit ihres wohlwollenden Gottes zu verbreiten und durch einen guten Lebenswandel und gute Taten ihr eigenes inneres Licht freizusetzen.
column6: Los maniqueos creen que hay dos principios originales en el universo, uno benigno (la Luz) y otro maligno (la Oscuridad). Un accidente cósmico provocó que se mezclasen, volviéndolo todo impuro, salvo a Dios. El objetivo de la humanidad es dar a conocer la sabiduría de su benévolo Dios y liberar su propia Luz interior mediante la buena conducta y la bondad.

column2: Followers of Taoism revere Tao, the underlying natural order of the Universe  the active expression of Tao for an individual is Te, the inner virtue. Adherents seek to strengthen their Te and prepare for the day they no longer need to stay hidden.
column3: Les taoïstes vénèrent Tao, l'ordre naturel sous-jacent de l'Univers - l'expression active de Tao pour un individu est Te, la vertu intérieure. Les adeptes cherchent à renforcer leur Te et à se préparer au jour où ils n'auront plus besoin de rester cachés.
column4: Anhänger des Taoismus verehren Tao, die zugrundeliegende natürliche Ordnung des Universums. Der aktive Ausdruck des Tao für ein Individuum ist das Te, die innere Tugend. Die Anhänger versuchen ihr Te zu stärken und sich auf den Tag vorzubereiten, an dem sie nicht mehr verborgen bleiben müssen.
column6: Los seguidores del taoísmo veneran el Teo, el orden subyacente natural del universo. La expresión activa del Tao en un individuo es el Te, la virtud interior. Sus adeptos buscan reforzar su Te y prepararse para el día en que no deban ocultarse.

column2: Believing themselves to be the protectors of understanding and knowledge in a world under the spell of Ahriman's ignorance, Zoroastrians organizing in secret spread the truth and light of Ahura Mazda's wisdom. Charged by their prophet with protecting the water, earth, fire and air, they enlighten others about the struggle between destructive chaos and the good of creation. Even when forced into secrecy there is yet hope, for Zoroaster told of the inevitability of Ahura Mazda's victory.
column3: Pensant être les protecteurs de la compréhension et du savoir dans un monde sous le charme de l'ignorance d'Ahriman, les zoroastriens répandent la sagesse d'Ahura Mazda. Chargés par leur prophète de protéger l'eau, la terre, le feu et l'air, ils cherchent à éclairer les autres sur la lutte entre le chaos destructeur et le bon de la création. Même lorsqu'ils sont forcés de pratiquer leur culte en secret, il y a toujours de l'espoir, car Zoroastre a annoncé l'inéluctabilité de la victoire d'Ahura Mazda.
column4: Die Zoroastrier, die sich als Beschützer des Wissens in einer Welt betrachten, die unter dem Bann des Unwissens von Ahriman steht, organisieren sich im Geheimen und verbreiten die Wahrheit und das Licht der Weisheit von Ahura Mazda. Von ihrem Propheten beauftragt, Wasser, Erde, Feuer und Luft zu schützen, versuchen sie verzweifelt, anderen den Kampf zwischen dem zerstörerischen Chaos und dem guten Wesen der Schöpfung begreiflich zu machen. Obwohl sie gezwungen sind, ihre Religion heimlich auszuüben, gibt es immer Hoffnung, da Zarathustra von der Unvermeidbarkeit des Sieges von Ahura Mazda erzählt hat.
column6: Los zoroastrianos se consideran los protectores del entendimiento y el conocimiento en un mundo que se encuentra bajo el hechizo de la ignorancia de Arimán. Su organización es secreta, y difunden la verdad y la luz de la sabiduría de Ahura Mazda. Su profeta les encomienda la protección del agua, la tierra, el fuego y el aire, y buscan desesperadamente hacer que otros entiendan la lucha entre el caos destructivo y la generosidad de la creación. Aunque se ven obligados a practicar en secreto, siempre hay esperanza, pues Zoroastro les ha hablado de la inevitable victoria de Ahura Mazda.

column2: Knowing of the inevitable coming of Ragnarok, as foretold in their saga scriptures, Norse believers will work even in secret to prepare the world for the snowy hell of the Fimbulvetr and the great battles of all-consuming fire it presages. Practicing their secret rituals in the name of the Allfather, they will accept any kind of warrior who can stand with them in the struggle against the chaos and desolation that other faiths seem intent on bringing upon the world.
column3: Connaissant la venue inévitable de Ragnarok, telle que prédite dans les Sagas, les croyants scandinaves travailleront même dans le secret pour préparer le monde à l'enfer neigeux de la Fimbulvetr et les grandes batailles du feu dévorant qu'il annonce. En pratiquant leurs rituels secrets au nom du Père de tout, ils accepteront tout type de guerrier qui peut se tenir avec eux dans la lutte contre le chaos et la désolation que les autres croyances semblent vouloir apporter au monde.
column4: Die Anhänger der nordgermanischen Religion, die vom Kommen von Ragnarök wissen, das in ihren Schriften und Sagas vorhergesagt wird, sind sogar im Geheimen tätig, um die Welt auf die verschneite Hölle des Fimbulwinters und die großen Schlachten des alles verzehrenden Feuers der Prophezeiungen vorzubereiten. Sie praktizieren ihre geheimen Rituale im Namen des Allvaters und akzeptieren jeden Krieger, der ihnen im Kampf gegen das Chaos und die Verwüstung, mit denen offenbar die Anhänger anderer Religionen die Welt überziehen wollen, beistehen kann.
column6: Conocedores de la inevitable llegada de Ragnarok, anunciada en la saga de sus escrituras, los creyentes nórdicos trabajarán incluso en secreto para preparar el mundo para el infierno nevado de Fimbulvetr y para las grandes batallas que presagia, de un fuego que lo consumirá todo. Practican rituales secretos en nombre del Padre de Todos, y aceptarán a cualquier guerrero, del tipo que sea, que pueda resistir junto a ellos en la lucha contra el caos y la desolación que otras fes parecen querer traer al mundo.

column2: Their identities marked by hidden axe amulets illustrating their devotion to Perun, underground Slavic curates pray in wild storms, their voices consumed by the thunder. In time they know that those who hunt them will be as powerless against the coming of Perun as the oak is against the lightning.
column3: Leur identité affirmée par une amulette cachée en forme de hache illustrant leur dévotion pour Péroun, les prêtres slaves prient secrètement lors de violentes tempêtes, la voix couverte par le tonnerre. Avec le temps, ils savent que ceux qui les chassent seront aussi impuissants face à la venue de Péroun que le chêne l'est face à la foudre.
column4: Slawische Kuraten des Untergrunds, die an verborgenen Axt-Amuletten zu erkennen sind, beten in starken Stürmen, in denen ihre Stimmen vom Donner verschlungen werden. Sie wissen, dass eine Zeit kommen wird, in der diejenigen, die Jagd auf sie machen, gegen das Kommen von Perun so hilflos sein werden wie die Eiche gegen den Blitz.
column6: Los vicarios eslavos clandestinos llevan su identidad marcada por amuletos de hacha ocultos que ilustran su devoción por Perún. Rezan en las virulentas tormentas, cuando el trueno consume sus voces. Al final, saben que aquellos que les dan caza quedarán tan impotentes ante la llegada de Perún como un roble ante un rayo.

column2: No matter how far you travel, and no matter what unbelievers say, you are always under the Heavenly Father, and standing upon the Earth Mother. This is how the followers of Tengri can be so certain in their faith that they follow it even in the face of persecution. All they have to do to prove their faith is to lift their eyes towards Tengri of the Blue Sky above, feel the protection nature provides, and let their Wind Horses ride in prayer to a better place.
column3: Peu importe la distance à laquelle vous voyagez, et peu importe ce que les incrédules disent, vous êtes toujours en dessous du Père céleste, et au-dessus de la Terre Mère. C'est ainsi que les adeptes de Tengri peuvent être si assurés dans leur foi, au point de la suivre même lorsqu'ils sont persécutés. Tout ce qu'ils ont à faire pour prouver leur foi est de lever les yeux vers Tengri du ciel bleu, sentir la protection que la nature leur fournit, et laisser leurs Chevaux du Vent les conduire, par la prière, vers un monde meilleur.
column4: Ganz gleich, wie weit sie reisen und was die Ungläubigen sagen, sind sie immer unter dem Himmelsvater und stehen auf der Mutter Erde. Daher können die Anhänger von Tengri so stark von ihrem Glauben überzeugt sein, dass sie selbst angesichts einer Verfolgung an ihm festhalten. Um ihren Glauben zu beweisen, brauchen sie lediglich den Blick auf Tengri, den blauen Himmel, zu richten, den Schutz zu spüren, den die Natur bietet, und ihre Windpferde im Gebet an einen besseren Ort reiten zu lassen.
column6: No importa cuán lejos hayas viajado, ni lo que digan los paganos: siempre estarás bajo el Padre Celestial y sobre la Madre Tierra. Así es cómo los seguidores de Tengri están tan seguros sobre la fe que siguen, aun cuando son perseguidos. Todo lo que deben hacer para demostrar su fe es alzar la vista hacia Tengri, allá en el cielo azul, sentir la protección que les brinda la naturaleza y dejar que sus caballos del viento cabalguen en sus oraciones por un lugar mejor.

column2: Even under the rule of another religion, the Suomenusko faith lives strong in some people. Communing with nature, they find their gods in the quiet places of the world. Among the trees, the brooks and the light of the moon, where they worship their divine kings in secret. But silence does not last forever, and it will soon be shattered by the storming in of Ukko on his chariot of thunder, his bolts of lightning striking the faithless to ash.
column3: Même sous le règne d'une autre religion, la foi suomenusko est très ancrée en certaines personnes. Communiant avec la nature, ils trouvent leurs dieux dans les lieux tranquilles du monde. Parmi les arbres, les ruisseaux et la lumière de la lune, où ils adorent leurs rois divins en secret. Mais le silence ne dure pas éternellement, et il sera bientôt brisé par l'assaut d'Ukko sur son char de tonnerre, sa foudre réduisant les infidèles en cendres.
column4: Selbst unter der Vorherrschaft einer anderen Religion ist der Suomenusko-Glaube in manchen Leuten auch weiterhin sehr stark verwurzelt. In der Zwiesprache mit der Natur finden sie ihre Götter an den stillen Orten der Welt, unter Bäumen, an Bächen und im Licht des Mondes, wo sie ihre göttlichen Könige heimlich anbeten können. Doch die Stille währt nicht ewig und wird bald durch das Heranstürmen von Ukko auf seinem Streitwagen des Donners und seine Blitze zerschlagen, die alle Ungläubigen zu Asche verbrennen.
column6: Incluso bajo el mandato de otra religión, la fe suomenusca vive con fuerza en el interior de algunos. Comulgan con la naturaleza y encuentran a sus dioses en los sitios en calma del mundo. Entre los árboles, en los arroyos y a la luz de la luna, donde adoran a sus reyes divinos a escondidas. Pero el silencio no es sempiterno y pronto quedará roto por la irrupción de Ukko, quien, montado sobre su carro de trueno, reducirá a cenizas a los infieles con sus rayos.

column2: As preachers proselytize, there are those who play their part, but in secret turn to the forces around them. No other gods have shown them the small miracles of the world, or the sheer divinity of life and existence. They tell each other stories of how faith does not reside in some otherworldly realm, but in the trees around them, the rocks by their feet, and the waters they drink of.
column3: Lorsque les prédicateurs font du prosélytisme, certains jouent leur rôle, mais en secret se tournent vers les forces autour d'eux. Aucun autre dieu ne leur a montré les petits miracles du monde, ni la pure divinité de la vie. Ils disent que la foi ne réside pas dans un royaume surnaturel, mais dans les arbres autour d'eux, les pierres sous leurs pieds, et l'eau qu'ils boivent.
column4: Wenn Priester Andersgläubige bekehren, halten sich einige an die ihnen zugedachte Rolle, wenden sich jedoch heimlich den Kräften zu, die sie umgeben. Keine anderen Götter haben ihnen die kleinen Wunder der Welt oder die reine Göttlichkeit des Lebens und des Daseins gezeigt. Sie erzählen einander Geschichten darüber, dass der Glaube nicht in irgendeinem jenseitigen Reich ruht, sondern in den Bäumen um sie herum, den Steinen zu ihren Füßen und den Gewässern, aus denen sie trinken.
column6: Mientras los predicadores hacen proselitismo, hay quienes juegan su papel pero, en secreto, se encomiendan a las fuerzas que los rodean. Los otros dioses no les han mostrado los pequeños milagros del mundo, ni la divinidad pura de la vida y la existencia. Se cuentan historias entre ellos, sobre cómo la fe no reside en un reino sobrenatural, sino en los árboles que se alzan a su alrededor, en las rocas que pisan y en las aguas que beben.

column2: The secret followers of Zun have little need for foreign faiths. The answer to every theological challenge and every moment of doubt is right in the sky above them, every day, without fail. It is what brings life and hope, deserving of every prostration. Just as Zun never fails to bring warmth to the earth and drive the night away, his followers will rise on the other side of their own long night.
column3: Les fidèles secrets de Zun ont peu besoin de croyances étrangères. La réponse à chaque défi théologique et chaque moment de doute est juste dans le ciel au-dessus d'eux, chaque jour, sans faute. C'est ce qui apporte la vie et l'espoir, méritant de toute prostration. Tout comme Zun ne manque jamais d'apporter la chaleur à la terre et de chasser la nuit, ses fidèles se lèveront après leur longue nuit.
column4: Die heimlichen Anhänger von Zun haben nur wenig Bedarf an fremden Religionen. Die Antwort auf jede theologische Herausforderung und jeden Augenblick des Zweifels steht jeden Tag und ohne jemals auszubleiben am Himmel über ihren Köpfen selbst geschrieben. Das ist es, was Leben und Hoffnung bringt und wofür sich jede Niederwerfung lohnt. Genau so, wie Zun immer wieder aufs Neue der Erde Wärme bringt und die Nacht vertreibt, erheben sich auch seine Anhänger auf der anderen Seite ihrer eigenen langen Nacht wieder.
column6: Los seguidores secretos de Zun no necesitan ninguna otra fe. La respuesta a toda cuestión teológica y a todo momento de duda se encuentra justo en el cielo que los cubre, cada día, sin falta. Es lo que les otorga la vida y la esperanza, merecedor de la postración de todos. Al igual que Zun nunca falla a la hora de repartir calor y ahuyentar la oscuridad, sus seguidores se alzarán al otro lado de su propia larga noche.

column2: Ever since its humble roots, Christians have marked themselves by their refusal to abandon their faith in the face of persecution. So it is that a rich tradition of martyrs and underground parishes can give hope to groups of believers in even the darkest of times, no matter what they are outwardly forced to profess. To each other they can profess their true faith in God, and their God is love.
column3: Dès leurs humbles origines, les chrétiens ont refusé d'abandonner leur foi face à la persécution. Ainsi, une riche tradition de martyrs et de paroisses secrètes peut donner de l'espoir à des groupes de croyants, même dans les périodes les plus difficiles, peu importe la religion qu'ils sont obligés de professer publiquement. Entre eux, ils peuvent professer leur vraie foi en Dieu, et leur Dieu est amour.
column4: Seit ihren bescheidenen Anfängen haben sich Christen durch ihre beharrliche Weigerung hervorgetan, angesichts der Verfolgung von ihrem Glauben abzulassen. Daher kann eine lange Tradition von Märtyrern und Untergrundgemeinden Gruppen von Gläubigen selbst in den finstersten Zeiten Hoffnung geben, ganz gleich, was sie durch Zwang nach außen hin bekennen müssen. Untereinander können sie ihren wahren Glauben an Gott bekennen, und ihr Gott heißt Liebe.
column6: Desde sus humildes orígenes, los cristianos se han caracterizado por su negativa a abandonar su fe ante la opresión. Tanto es así, que una nutrida tradición de mártires y parroquias clandestinas consigue dar esperanza a grupos de creyentes incluso en los tiempos más oscuros, sin importar qué otra fe les obligan a profesar en público. Entre ellos pueden mostrar su verdadera fe en Dios, y su Dios es amor.

column2: Seeing themselves as walking in the footsteps of the Apostles who first built the Church in the name of Christ, there are Christians who will not give up their faith, even when circumstance has forced them to renounce their words. They continue the good work, building their faith and their church, knowing in their hearts that they are doing God's will.
column3: Pensant suivre les pas des apôtres qui ont construit l'Église au nom du Christ, certains chrétiens ne renoncent pas à leur foi, même quand les circonstances les forcent à ne pas l'exprimer publiquement. Ils poursuivent cette oeuvre, renforçant leur foi et leur Église, sachant au fond d'eux qu'ils exaucent la volonté de Dieu.
column4: Sie sehen sich selbst als Nachfolger der Apostel, die zu Beginn im Namen von Jesus Christus die Kirche aufgebaut haben, und wenden sich auch dann nicht von ihrem Glauben ab, wenn sie durch äußere Umstände dazu gezwungen werden, ihre Lehren zu verleugnen. Sie setzen ihr gutes Werk und den Aufbau ihres Glaubens und ihrer Kirche fort, da sie in ihren Herzen wissen, dass sie den Willen von Gott ausführen.
column6: Hay cristianos que se ven a sí mismos siguiendo los pasos de los apóstoles que fundaron la Iglesia en nombre de Cristo, y que no renunciarán a su fe, aun cuando las circunstancias los han forzado a callar sus plegarias. Continúan con su buena labor, construyendo su fe y su iglesia, sabiendo en lo hondo de su alma que están siguiendo la voluntad de Dios.

column2: Followers of Hinduism believe it to be The Eternal Way, and even when forced to utter the blessings of another spirit, some know that in the samsara all things will come to pass, and the natural order of things will return. In the cycle of destruction and creation, death and rebirth, endings and beginnings, no other truth will stand victorious for long.
column3: Les adeptes de l'hindouisme croient en la renaissance éternelle, et même lorsqu'ils sont forcés de prononcer leurs bénédictions à un autre esprit, certains savent que dans le samsara, toute chose a une fin et que l'ordre naturel des choses finira par revenir. Dans le cycle de la destruction et de la création, de la mort et de la renaissance, des fins et des commencements, aucune autre vérité ne sera victorieuse pour longtemps.
column4: Die Anhänger des Hinduismus betrachten dies als die ewige Ordnung, und selbst wenn sie gezwungen werden, die Segnungen eines anderen Geistes auszusprechen, wissen einige von ihnen, dass im Samsara alle Dinge ihren Lauf nehmen werden und die natürliche Ordnung der Dinge zurückkehren wird. Im Zyklus von Zerstörung und Schöpfung, Tod und Wiedergeburt und Ende und Anfang kann keine andere Wahrheit lange Bestand haben.
column6: Los seguidores del hinduismo creen que es la religión eterna y, aunque se ven obligados a adorar a otro espíritu, algunos saben que en el samsara todo acaba pasando y el orden natural de las cosas vuelve. En el ciclo de destrucción y creación, muerte y renacimiento, finales y principios, ninguna otra verdad perdurará.

column2: Catharism is a Gnostic sect centered around a dualistic doctrine. The Good Christians', as the Cathar faithful calls themselves, believe in two Gods - the good God who is the creator of the heavenly spiritual realm and the evil God who created the physical world with all its temptations and suffering.
column3: Le catharisme est une secte gnostique centrée autour d'une doctrine dualiste. Les bons chrétiens, comme s'appellent eux-mêmes les cathares, croient en deux dieux: le bon Dieu qui est le créateur du royaume spirituel céleste et le Dieu malin qui a créé le monde physique avec toutes ses tentations et ses souffrances.
column4: Der Katharismus ist eine gnostische Sekte mit einer dualistischen Doktrin. Die guten Christen, wie sich die Katharer selbst nennen, glauben an zwei Götter: den guten Gott, der das spirituelle Himmelreich erschaffen hat, und den bösen Gott, der die physische Welt mit ihren Versuchungen und ihrem Leiden erschaffen hat.
column6: El catarismo es una secta gnóstica en torno a dos realidades opuestas. Los «Buenos hombres», como los fieles catáros se llaman a sí mismos, creen en dos dioses: el buen Dios, creador del mundo espiritual, y el dios malo, creador del mundo físico con todas sus tentaciones y sufrimiento.

column2: The Messalians, 'the ones who pray', are a Christian sect. They believe that perfection can only be attained by perceiving God as He reveals Himself to the carnal senses. To bring forth such revelations, the only path is prayer - neither the church, baptism or any other sacrament can drive the desires from the soul and invite God.
column3: Les messaliens, « ceux qui prient », sont une secte chrétienne. Ils croient que la perfection ne peut être atteinte qu'en percevant Dieu lorsqu'il se révèle aux cinq sens. Pour faire naître ces révélations, le seul chemin est la prière - ni l'Église, ni le baptême, ni aucun autre sacrement ne peut chasser les désirs de l'âme et inviter Dieu.
column4: Die Messalianer (die Betenden) sind eine christliche Sekte. Sie glauben, dass Perfektion nur durch die Wahrnehmung Gottes, wie er sich den fleischlichen Sinnen offenbart, erlangt werden kann. Der einzige Weg zur Hervorrufung solcher Offenbarungen ist das Gebet und weder die Kirche noch die Taufe noch ein anderes Sakrament kann die Begierden aus der Seele treiben und Gott herbeirufen.
column6: Los mesalianos, «quienes no rezan», son una secta cristiana. Creen que la perfección solo puede alcanzarse percibiendo a Dios por sus revelaciones a través de los sentidos carnales. El único camino para que se produzcan esas revelaciones es la oración: ni la Iglesia, ni el bautismo ni ningún otro sacramento puede impulsar los deseos del alma e invitar a Dios.

column2: The Zikris follow the teachings of the Quran, believed to have been verbally recited to Muhammed by God. They will proclaim that Muhammed is chosen by God, as prophet and the first Imam.
column3: Les zikris suivent les enseignements du Coran, censés avoir été verbalement transmis à Mahomet par Dieu. Ils affirmeront que Mahomet a été choisi par Dieu, en tant que prophète et premier imam.
column4: Die Zikris folgen den Lehren des Korans, von denen sie glauben, Mohammed habe sie von Allah selbst erfahren. Sie behaupten, Mohammed sei von Allah als Prophet und erster Imam auserwählt worden.
column6: Los zikris siguen en secreto las enseñanzas del Corán, cuyo contenido se cree que Dios recitó a Mahoma. Proclaman que Mahoma es el elegido de Dios, como profeta y como el primer imán.

column2: The Yazidis believe that God created the world and tasked seven holy angels with its care. The first of the angels is the ambivalent Melek Taus, the Peacock Angel, a ruler who causes both good and bad to befall his mortal subjects.
column3: Les yézidis croient que Dieu a créé le monde et l'a assigné à sept anges. Le premier des anges est l'ambivalent Malek Taous, l'ange paon, un souverain à l'origine du bien et du mal frappant ses sujets mortels.
column4: Die Jesiden glauben, dass Gott die Welt erschaffen und sieben heilige Engel damit beauftragt habe, sich um die Welt zu kümmern. Der erste dieser Engel ist der ambivalente Melek Taus, der Pfauenengel, ein Herrscher, der sowohl für das Glück als auch für das Unglück verantwortlich ist, das seinen sterblichen Untertanen widerfährt.
column6: Los yazidíes creen que Dios creó el mundo y lo puso al cuidado de siete ángeles sagrados. El primero de estos ángeles es Melek Taus, «el ángel pavo real», un líder que provoca el bien y el mal sobre sus sujetos mortales.

column2: The Hurufi follow the teachings of the Quran, believed to have been verbally recited to Muhammed by God. They will proclaim that Muhammed is chosen by God, as prophet and the first Imam. They spread their belief that God, through Muhammed, chose Ali as his successor, and thus the first caliph of the state of Islam. They will stand by what they believe to be the true word of God.
column3: Les hurufites suivent les enseignements du Coran, censés avoir été verbalement transmis à Mahomet par Dieu. Ils affirmeront que Mahomet a été choisi par Dieu, en tant que prophète et premier imam. Ils répandent leur croyance que Dieu, par Mahomet, a choisi Ali comme son successeur, et donc comme premier calife de l'État de l'Islam. Ils resteront fidèles à ce qu'ils croient être la vraie Parole de Dieu.
column4: Die Hurufi folgen den Lehren des Korans, von denen sie glauben, Mohammed habe sie von Allah selbst erfahren. Sie behaupten, Mohammed sei von Allah als Prophet und erster Imam auserwählt worden. Sie verbreiten ihren Glauben, Allah habe Ali durch Mohammed zu seinem Nachfolger und somit zum ersten Kalifen des Islamischen Staates erwählt. Sie sind felsenfest davon überzeugt, dass alles, was sie glauben, dem wahren Wort von Allah entspricht.
column6: Los hurufíes siguen en secreto las enseñanzas del Corán, cuyo contenido se cree que Dios recitó a Mahoma. Proclaman que Mahoma es el elegido de Dios, como profeta y como el primer imán. Profesan la creencia de que Dios, a través de Mahoma, eligió a Alí como su sucesor y, por ende, como primer califa del estado islámico. Se mantienen firmes sobre lo que creen que es la verdadera palabra de Dios.

column2: The Khawariji follow the teachings of the Quran, believed to have been verbally recited to Muhammed by God. Unlike many other Muslim groups, they believe that any righteous and pious Muslim can become caliph, and that is is their duty to revolt against any ruler who deviates from their interpretation of Islam. Martyrdom and dying for Allah is a strong desire among the Khawariji.
column3: Les kharidjites suivent les enseignements du Coran, censés avoir été verbalement transmis à Mahomet par Dieu. Contrairement à beaucoup d'autres groupes musulmans, ils croient que n'importe quel musulman juste et pieux peut devenir le calife, et c'est leur devoir de se révolter contre tout dirigeant qui s'écarte de leur interprétation de l'islam. Ils sont prêts à mourir en martyre pour Allah.
column4: Die Charidschiten folgen den Lehren des Korans, von denen sie glauben, Mohammed habe sie von Allah selbst erfahren. Im Gegensatz zu anderen mohammedanischen Gruppen glauben die Charidschiten, dass jeder rechtschaffene und fromme Mohammedaner Kalif werden kann und dass es ihre Pflicht ist, sich gegen jeden Herrscher aufzulehnen, der von ihrer Auslegung des Islam abweicht. Das Märtyrertum und der Tod für Allah spielen bei den Charidschiten eine große Rolle.
column6: Los jariyitas siguen en secreto las enseñanzas del Corán, cuyo contenido se cree que Dios recitó a Mahoma. Al contrario que muchos otros grupos musulmanes, ellos creen que cualquier musulmán recto y piadoso puede convertirse en califa, y que es su deber sublevarse contra cualquier líder que no siga su interpretación del islam. El martirio y la muerte en nombre de Alá son un deseo ferviente entre los jariyitas.

column2: The Samaritans believe that they follow the true religion of the Israelites, as it was before the Babylonian Captivity. Their tenants are similar to those of Judaism, but they have their own version of the Torah and pray facing Mount Gerizim, which they believe is the one true sanctuary chosen by God.
column3: Les samaritains croient qu'ils suivent la vraie religion des israélites, comme c'était le cas avant la captivité babylonienne. Ils ont leur propre version de la Torah et prient face au mont Garizim, qui, selon eux, est le seul sanctuaire choisi par Dieu.
column4: Die Samaritaner glauben, dass sie der wahren Religion der Israeliten folgen, wie sie vor der babylonischen Gefangenschaft beschaffen war. Ihre Lehren ähneln denen des Judentums, aber sie besitzen ihre eigene Version der Tora und wenden sich beim Gebet dem Berg Garizim zu, den sie für den einzig wahren von Gott erwählten heiligen Ort halten.
column6: Los samaritanos creen que siguen la verdadera religión de los israelitas, tal y como era antes del Cautiverio de Babilonia. Sus principios son similares a los del judaísmo, pero tienen su propia versión de la Torá y rezan hacia el Monte Guerizín, que creen que es el único y verdadero santuario elegido por Dios.

column2: Hidden Karaite communities have organized under oppression ever since the time of the Babylonian captivity. These groups welcome both those forced to convert away of Judaism, the Anusim, and those who have secretly become righteous converts, the ger tzedek. A community always cares for its own, knowing that as ages pass, true faith is worth persevering for. God will provide.
column3: Les communautés cachées karaïtes se sont organisées sous l'oppression depuis l'époque de la captivité babylonienne. Ces groupes accueillent à la fois ceux qui ont été forcés d'abandonner le judaïsme, les Anoussim, et ceux qui se sont secrètement convertis, les ger tizedek. Une communauté s'occupe toujours de ses propres, sachant que comme les âges passent, la vraie foi vaut la peine persévérer pour. Dieu fournira.
column4: Seit der babylonischen Gefangenschaft wurden in Zeiten der Unterdrückung immer wieder versteckte Karaitengemeinden gegründet. Diese Gruppen heißen sowohl die Anusim willkommen, die gezwungen wurden, sich vom Judentum abzuwenden, als auch die "ger tzedek", die heimlich zu rechtmäßigen Konvertiten geworden sind. Eine Gemeinde sorgt stets für ihre Angehörigen, da bekannt ist, dass im Lauf der Jahrhunderte wahrer Glaube es wert ist, standhaft an ihm festzuhalten. Gott wird für die Seinen sorgen.
column6: Comunidades karaítas secretas se han organizado bajo la opresión desde los tiempos del Cautiverio de Babilonia. Estos grupos incluyen tanto a aquellos obligados a dejar la fe judía, los anusim, como a aquellos que han pasado a ser rectos conversos en secreto, los ger tzedek. Una comunidad siempre cuida de los suyos, sabiendo que con el paso del tiempo, vale la pena preservar la fe verdadera. Dios proveerá.

column2: The Mazdaki believe that there are two original principles of the universe - the good Light and the evil Darkness. By a cosmic accident, the two has been mixed, and everything is tainted but God. Mankind's purpose is to spread the wisdom of their benevolent God and releasing their own inner Light through good conduct and kind actions.
column3: Les mazdakites croient qu'il y a deux principes à l'origine de l'univers - la bonne Lumière et les Ténèbres maléfiques. Par un accident cosmique, les deux ont été mélangés, et tout est entaché sauf Dieu. Le but de l'humanité est de répandre la sagesse de leur Dieu bienveillant et de libérer leur propre Lumière intérieure par les bonnes actions.
column4: Die Mazdakiten glauben, dass es zwei ursprüngliche Grundprinzipien des Universums gibt: das gute Licht und die böse Finsternis. Durch einen kosmischen Unfall wurden diese beiden Prinzipien vermischt und ist alles außer Gott befleckt. Der Zweck der Menschheit besteht darin, die Weisheit ihres wohlwollenden Gottes zu verbreiten und durch einen guten Lebenswandel und gute Taten ihr eigenes inneres Licht freizusetzen.
column6: Los mazdekitas creen que hay dos principios originales en el universo, uno benigno (la Luz) y otro maligno (la Oscuridad). Un accidente cósmico provocó que se mezclasen, volviéndolo todo impuro, salvo a Dios. El objetivo de la humanidad es dar a conocer la sabiduría de su benévolo Dios y liberar su propia Luz interior mediante la buena conducta y la bondad.
